system.description:
War drummers slam their rubber wrapped sticks against great deerskin drums and clang them against giant golden gongs. These drums are the songs of legends, the thundering of heroes, and it bolsters the Akayu upon the field.

(The stats provided here is for a Rank 1 encounter. Check the book for higher ranks.)
system.attacks:
Inflict Violence: Gong. Slide 2 a fighter in range 2. Any one ally may inflict violence against the fighter if they can at any point of the movement.

Gambits [[/r d12]]

1-3: Rush > Inflict Violence > Rush

4-6: Rush > Inflict Violence > Thunderous! [1]: Give all allies in burst 2 +1 to their Speed and Jump.

7-9: Rush > Striking Drum Beat [2]: Attack all enemies in an area (blast 4) with Bravery, then all allies in the blast may fly 1.

10-12: Epic In Progress [3]: Give Block 2 on all allies in the battlefield.

traits.name: Conviction
traits.description: All Folk have a reason for fighting, and if reasoned to, can cause them to rethink combat. However, they will fight for their Conviction until it looks like all is bleak.

traits.name: Morale
traits.description: At the beginning of any Resound where there are twice as many Kadungganan than there are enemies (eg., If there are 4 Kadungganan and 2 Enemies left) all Folk enemies will Surrender, becoming Defeated.

traits.name: Divine Striving
traits.description: Whenever a fighter falls to 0 HP, all Akayu fighters gain Striving until the end of their next riff. Their attacks gain Overwhelming and they have +1 to all Prowesses. When they lose Striving, they heal 2.

traits.name: Echo!
traits.description: When the War Drummer gains Striving, they give +2d to their own and their allies' next attacks. At the start of their riff, they can choose any ally in the battlefield. That ally becomes Striving.
